forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 7 to 10 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere today is draped in a blanket of muted greys, reflecting an afternoon that leans towards the cool and cloudy. The temperature resides comfortably in the mid-fifties, but a gentle south-southwest wind stirs softly, keeping the air crisp and enlivened. As daylight wanes, the clouds continue to gather, hinting at the rain that will arrive later in the evening. With a 90% chance of precipitation set to begin around 10 PM, it's clear that staying indoors might soon be the preferred option for many.

The cityscape features a veil of low clouds down by the bay, with hints of a marine layer swirling gently around the edges of the Golden Gate Bridge, beckoning those inclined to wander along its paths. Today, warmth lies in layers: a light jacket is advisable, perhaps with a cozy sweater underneath to counter the occasional chill. For those daring to embrace the murky beauty, a stroll through the serene stretches of Golden Gate Park or a quiet café visit downtown can be delightful ways to savor the day before the rain forces retreat indoors. A quiet contemplation over a warm drink might just be the perfect counterpoint to the looming clouds overhead.
